intro: Aldama veredensis, commonly known as the Veredén Aldama, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. The flowers are yellow to orange in color, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
